intro: Erigeron camposportoi, commonly known as the Texas fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron camposportoi is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
